verse: Not long after, Moses and Aaron confronted Pharaoh.
That same day, Pharaoh gave instructions to the slave drivers who were over the people and their supervisors.
The people quickly and desperately spread out across the land of Egypt looking for dry stalks of grain to use for straw.
The slave drivers pushed them hard.
Plus they beat and interrogated the supervisors of the Israelites, the Hebrews whom the slave drivers had appointed over the workers.
The supervisors of the Israelites were unable to meet the demands and so they appealed to Pharaoh.
The supervisors of the Israelites knew they were in deep trouble when they were told, “You are not to lessen the workload. You must still make the same number of bricks every day as you did before.”
After the supervisors left Pharaoh, they went directly to Moses and Aaron who were already waiting for them.
Moses went back to meet with the Eternal One.
